list.comment: output csmPos is non-biased position that can be used for sampling shadow map after homogeneous divid
list.name: CCCSMFactorBase

list.comment: for right-hand coordinates, params must be normalized
list.name: CalculateBinormal

list.comment:
fix cubemap direction with box projection
 return unnormalized vector and weight for exceeding
list.name: CalculateBoxProjectedDirection

list.comment:
param1 is normal from normalmap
 return value is un-normalized
list.name: CalculateNormalFromTangentSpace

list.comment:
return unnormalized vector, support oppo-side
 V from pixel to camera
list.name: CalculateRefractDirection

list.comment:
How to get an anisotropic offset along T/B:
 1. accurate: rotation TBN basis, let N intend to T/B, such as flow map as normalmap, output vec3(0, delta, 1) instead of vec3(0, 0, 1)
 2. not accurate: H intend to V, and passed to this function
list.name: D_GGXAniso

list.comment: fraction is saturation percentage, 0 means gray
list.name: Desaturation

list.comment:
dithered transparency (dithered alpha test), better looking with TAA
 arguments: FSInput_clipPos, cc_viewPort.zw, baseColor.a
list.name: DitheredAlphaClip

list.comment:
depthHS (Z) = ndc depth(-1 ~ +1)
 return camera depth (W), negative in RH
list.name: GetCameraDepthRH

list.comment:
fast rotation for anisotropic offset
 rotationAngle: -1 - +1
list.name: RotateNormalAndBinormal

list.comment: for exr data texture and sub resources
list.name: SampleTextureExr

list.comment:
return 0.0 when out of range
 hardness: 0 - 1
list.name: SphereMask

list.comment:
depends on CC_SURFACES_FRAGMENT_ALPHA_CLIP_ONLY
 for base shape without color usage, such as render-to-shadow
list.name: SurfacesFragmentAlphaClipOnly

list.comment:
depends on CC_SURFACES_FRAGMENT_MODIFY_ANISOTROPY_PARAMS
 isRotation=1.0: shape(0~1), rotation(0~2PI), 0.0, 0.0
 or
 isRotation=0.0: shape(0~1), anisoDir.xyz(-1~1)
list.name: SurfacesFragmentModifyAnisotropyParams

list.comment:
depends on CC_SURFACES_FRAGMENT_MODIFY_SHARED_DATA
 some material datas use shared raw data, avoid sample / calculate same raw data multiply times, use this function for better performance
 this function invokes at last
 should use corresponding shading-model header: #include <surfaces/data-structures/XXX> before function define
list.name: SurfacesFragmentModifySharedData

list.comment:
depends on CC_SURFACES_FRAGMENT_MODIFY_TRANSMIT_SCATTERING_PARAMS
 scattering related parameters and colors
list.name: SurfacesFragmentModifyTransmitScatteringParams

list.comment:
depends on CC_SURFACES_VERTEX_MODIFY_LOCAL_SHARED_DATA
 some vertex datas use shared raw data, avoid sample / calculate same raw data multiply times, use this function for better performance
 this function invokes before world transform
list.name: SurfacesVertexModifyLocalSharedData

list.comment:
depends on CC_SURFACES_VERTEX_MODIFY_SHADOW_BIAS
 shadow bias for submesh-level
list.name: SurfacesVertexModifyShadowBias

list.comment:
depends on CC_SURFACES_VERTEX_MODIFY_SHARED_DATA
 some vertex datas use shared raw data, avoid sample / calculate same raw data multiply times, use this function for better performance
 this function invokes at last
list.name: SurfacesVertexModifySharedData

list.comment:
tangent space -> world space
 same as TransformVector
list.name: TransformNormalMap

list.comment:
/////////////////////////////////////////// public functions
 auto calculation frame count for fluid
list.name: VATCalculateFrameCount

list.comment:
meshUV use texCoord0 for fluid
 meshUV use texCoord1 for rigid-body and soft-body
list.name: VATGetAnimUV

list.comment:
return absolute position for fluid
 return position offset for soft-body
list.name: VATGetLocalPosition

list.comment: TRUE if all elements are non-zero
list.name: all

list.comment: Returns TRUE if any one element is non-zero
list.name: any

list.comment: Calculates the arctangent of a given value, no quadrant can be determined
list.name: atan

list.comment: Computes the arctangent of y/x and can determine the quadrant
list.name: atan2

list.comment: x: single mode, yzw: composite and misc flags combination value
list.name: cc_mainLitDir

list.comment: x -> cc_matLightProj[0];             y -> cc_matLightProj[5];             z -> 1.0 / cc_matLightProj[0];        w -> 1.0 / cc_matLightProj[5];
list.name: cc_shadowNFLSInfo

list.comment: x -> cc_matLightProj[10]([2][2]);    y -> cc_matLightProj[14]([2][3]);    z -> cc_matLightProj[11]([3][2]);    w -> cc_matLightProj[15]([3][3]);
list.name: cc_shadowProjInfo

list.comment: xyz: camera position w: flip NDC sign
list.name: cc_viewPort

list.comment: Take the integer that is greater than or equal to it and closest to it
list.name: ceil

list.comment: Be especially careful with UINT variables, which must be converted to int before being passed in
list.name: clamp

list.comment: Low precision, not supported by GLES
list.name: dFdxCoarse

list.comment: High precision, not supported by GLES
list.name: dFdxFine

list.comment: Low precision, not supported by GLES
list.name: dFdyCoarse

list.comment: High precision, not supported by GLES
list.name: dFdyFine

list.comment: Make a judgment for each element of Data1 and Data2
list.name: equal

list.comment: Assume normalized input. Output is on [-1, 1] for each component.
list.name: float32x3_to_oct

list.comment: equivalent to asint, reads the floating point value as INT bit by bit, without changing the bit value
list.name: floatBitsToInt

list.comment: equivalent to asuint, reads the floating point value as a UINT number bit by bit, without changing the bit value
list.name: floatBitsToUint

list.comment: Take the integer that is less than or equal to it and closest to it
list.name: floor

list.comment: Double type and safe calculation of a*b+c
list.name: fma

list.comment: Floating-point special remainder function, equivalent to Data % Divisor
list.name: fmod

list.comment: decompose a number and return its tail, parameter 2 is the exponent of the output, with a base of 10
list.name: frexp

list.comment: Returns the sum of the absolute values of the partial derivatives of the input data, i.e., the sum of the absolute values of each of the two partial derivatives, which is equivalent to taking the absolute values internally before adding the gradients return abs(ddx)+abs(ddy)
list.name: fwidth

list.comment: Judgment for each element of Data1 and Data2
list.name: greaterThan

list.comment: Judgment for each element of Data1 and Data2
list.name: greaterThanEqual

list.comment: Equivalent to asfloat, reads int numbers as floating point values bit by bit, without changing the bit value
list.name: intBitsToFloat

list.comment: whether it is finite, remove the possibility of irrational numbers and infinite size values, mainly used to judge the validity
list.name: isfinite

list.comment: whether it is infinitely large or infinitely small
list.name: isinf

list.comment: whether it is an irrational number
list.name: isnan

list.comment: Judge each element of Data1 and Data2
list.name: lessThan

list.comment: Make a judgment for each element of Data1 and Data2
list.name: lessThanEqual

list.comment: Base on the natural logarithm e
list.name: log

list.comment: Calculate the product of two matrices one by one for each element
list.name: matrixCompMult

list.comment: Floating-point-specific remainder function, equivalent to Data % divide
list.name: mod

list.comment: return the fractional part, parameter 2 is the output of the integer part, the sign of these two parts will be the same as the input value
list.name: modf

list.comment: Can only be used in ShaderModel1
list.name: noise

list.comment: Judgment for each element of Data1 and Data2
list.name: notEqual

list.comment:
random number
 seeds value must be between zero to one, otherwise get 0
 such as fract(cc_time.z * FSInput_texcoord)
list.name: rand

list.comment: IncidentDirection is from elsewhere to pixel
list.name: reflect

list.comment: IncidentDirection is from elsewhere to pixel
list.name: refract

list.comment: Do Hermite smoothing for the specified parameter 3, so that it changes from linear to curved, if the parameter 3 falls outside the min and max range, then Clamp, note that it is not a real Hermite curve, does not involve the tangent vector, there is not much controllability, can only be seen as a typical Hermite curve smoothing only
list.name: smoothstep

list.comment: return A <= B or B >= A floating point number, remove the bool value conversion
list.name: step

list.comment: Query the number of MSAA sampling points, __VERSION__>=450
list.name: textureSamples

list.comment: equivalent to asfloat, which reads UINT numbers as floating point values bit by bit, without changing the bit value
list.name: uintBitsToFloat
